The White House is considering more immigration policies that could again result in family separations at the U.S Mexico border NPR's Julia Bailey reports
Officials told the Washington Post the administration is hoping to reverse the numbers of families attempting to cross illegally into the United states
One option is for the government to detain asylum seeking families together for up to twenty days then give parents choice stay in family detention with their children for months or years as their immigration case proceeds or allow their children's be taken to a government shelter so other relatives or guardians conceit custody
